title: Spaceway experts- Now with ref pics-

posts.content: In the mean time, some pics of the curtains when I had them fitted. Sorry for quality of shots, it's an iPad shot of a photo!
Remember opinions on the seat cushion would be much appreciated.

spanker wrote:There you go, sorry for the poor light, just took them in the garage. I do have a close up of the attachment in the series of shots posted yesterday. Let me know if you need more, will do in better light


Thank you.

Are both ends of the 'stay' the same? And where do you store/stash it? I have never seen one in the flesh before, something that would easily get lost.

The close-ups of the flush mount bracket and 'stay' bracket on cargo door are excellent in your previous post, if possible could you post a photo of the little bracket just below the cargo door latch and the 'stay' bracket on the table/shelf. I would appreciate a photo of the bottom of table/shelf where it attaches to cargo door, just looking to confirm I have the correct piece?

Cheers

Well I have actually seen and touched Spanker's in the flesh. ..oooeeerrr.. Friend of mine Mark Buckingham has a Velvet Green kombi based Torvette Spaceway.
He donated the bed making tutorial photographs.
I will go and see or email and ask him for pictures and dimensions. ...for comparison. ..
When I return from the tour..
G

The curtains are the blue purple and black ones... I have these from my 1965 Caravette... with Sea Blue paint work..
If you want a new home for them...
G

YOURS!:|

type21f wrote:Well I have actually seen and touched Spankers in the flesh. ..ooòer..
G

barndoorz wrote:
type21f wrote:Well I have actually seen and touched Spankers in the flesh. ..ooòer..
G




That's why they call me Spanker!

barndoorz wrote:
spanker wrote:There you go, sorry for the poor light, just took them in the garage. I do have a close up of the attachment in the series of shots posted yesterday. Let me know if you need more, will do in better light


Thank you.

Are both ends of the 'stay' the same? And where do you store/stash it? I have never seen one in the flesh before, something that would easily get lost.

The close-ups of the flush mount bracket and 'stay' bracket on cargo door are excellent in your previous post, if possible could you post a photo of the little bracket just below the cargo door latch and the 'stay' bracket on the table/shelf. I would appreciate a photo of the bottom of table/shelf where it attaches to cargo door, just looking to confirm I have the correct piece?

Cheers


The strut pictured came with the van but I am 100% sure it is not correct as it is too long and looks nothing like the versions I have seen on other Spaceways, so discount that piece. When I get round to it, I will probably make a correct replacement from the correct gauge steel rod.
I will get a close up of the bracket on the underside of the table top as soon as I am able.

type21f wrote:The curtains are the blue purple and black ones... I have these from my 1965 Caravette... with Sea Blue paint work..
If you want a new home for them...
G

Sent from my SM-G900F using Tapatalk


Are you offering to sell yours or buy mine??
Ps nobody has mentioned this yet?

Well it is orange. ..odd material and nothing O have ever seen..
Mine came with a pair of tights stuffed in a nook and cranny.. a bar mat from Spain and a plaque from a Scottish VW Festival snd five odd old pennies. ..
None OG Devon equipment. .
Oh and an odd bent section of aluminium tube. ..which even I cannot fathom s use gor..
So nice but I think not Devon...
G

Sent from my SM-G900F using Tapatalk
Thats a shame as I was happy to swap it for an NOS Devon cutlery roll. I will have to keep enjoying its 70s orangey hue for now then!
